alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 29 at 11:25PM CST until November 30 at 12:15AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1215 AM CST. * At 1123 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Ellisville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wayne County, including locations near the Lightsey and Whistler communities. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
